abstract.text: Create a displayable ARGB image using the luminance and chrominance information from your device’s camera.

metadata.title: Converting luminance and chrominance planes to an ARGB image

inlineContent.text: As an alternative to the any-to-any conversion technique that
describes, vImage provides low-level functions for creating RGB images from the separate luminance and chrominance planes that an
instance provides. These functions offer better performance and more granular configuration than using a
instance.
The
function
generates the information that vImage requires to convert the luminance and chrominance planes to a single ARGB image.
Video-range YpCbCr formats often don’t use very low and very high values. For example, an 8-bit
video range format typically uses the range
for luminance and
for chrominance.
The generate conversion function accepts a
structure that defines the pixel range.
The following code example populates a
structure with the required conversion information for video-range 8-bit pixels:

inlineContent.text: Before the sample app accesses the pixel data that AVFoundation supplies as a
, it calls
to lock the pixel buffer and make the underlying memory available.
After the YpCbCr-to-RGB conversion is complete, the code calls
to unlock the pixel buffer.
The
function performs the YpCbCr-to-RGB conversion.

content.text: Create the source luminance and chrominance pixel buffers

inlineContent.text: The
function creates two pixel buffers that share memory with
the
. The Core Video pixel
buffer contains two planes: the plane at index
contains one channel that represents the luminance component,
the plane at index
contains two interleaved channels that represent the two chrominance components.
The
function initializes a
that references a single plane of a multiple-plane Core Video pixel buffer.

abstract.text: An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, bit depth, and number of channels.
Populates the pixel buffer with ARGB data from the given luminance and chrominance pixel buffers.
Initializes a pixel buffer by refencing the data from a single plane of a multiplane Core Video pixel buffer.
Converts a planar Yp buffer and a 2-channel CbCr buffer to an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel ARGB buffer.
Generates the information that describes the conversion from YpCbCr to ARGB.
A description of a conversion from one image format to another.
The description of range and clamping information for YpCbCr pixel formats.
The information that describes the conversion from YpCbCr to ARGB.
Manipulate large images using the CPU’s vector processor.
An object that configures capture behavior and coordinates the flow of data from input devices to capture outputs.
Locks the base address of the pixel buffer.
Unlocks the base address of the pixel buffer.
An image buffer that holds pixels in main memory.
A control for selecting a value from a bounded linear range of values.
